intro: Borreria cornifolia, commonly known as the horned borreria, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a distinctive, often hairy texture. Borreria cornifolia is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
